And the rolling shutter at around 3:18 is the worst I¬¥ve ever seen.

Some other specs are nice but I don¬¥t get why Sony released such a camera. Anyway it will find its friends and that¬¥s fine. But it¬¥s not a sensation at all. If Canon had done it the bashing around the web would be incredible.

Gonna be a LOT of talk about this camera.  People wanting features like IBIS and such will just have to wait for the a7000.  The 6400 is an interesting camera.   the problem is it has incredibly potential as a camera for photography, but they're trying to cater to vloggers as well, which is hard to do with the microphone port being where it is.  Has anyone seen the monstrosity they posted where it's a pistol grip on the bottom, a plate, then the camera and mic side by side?   You tested the on camera mic, but the issue is when using an external mic, and where to put it. Also the rolling shutter was REALLY bad.  Wonder what codec you shot in.  anyways, I'll have to make a video on it myself when/if I get my hands on one.  Nice overall review Louis!  curious to see if you hold onto this camera and use it!

@Mohsin Sait I actually don't think so. The a7III is going to sit, and probably stay at $2000.  The A7000 will be at the most, $1500 (I hope). $500 is a brand new lens, so that's quite the chunk of change. Also there is a clear cut difference, and that's the sensor.  One is built for APSC lenses, and the other is built for FE lenses. Obviously you can use either type of lens on either body (the beauty of the E mount), but some people want full frame vs APSC. I myself, don't want to go full frame yet.  I hold near and dear to my heart the lighter weight system of the a6000. If the a7000 is a little heavier, but I can stick with lenses like the sony 35mm f1.8 (APSC) and have featurs of the bigger/heavier A7III then I'm sold!  You are right, but I don't think it will be too hard for people.

@hikyletaggart hmm, you're right. That $300 extra is worth a lot more but, again for another $200 you get an a7 mk3. Full frame, big battery, better evf, and probably better weather sealing. People are gonna have a hard time choosing between the a7000 and a7 3.

@Mohsin Sait But what is the a7000 is $300 more, has IBIS, more rugged body, centered viewfinder, better viewfinder, better screen, BIGGER battery, and yet still a small size? The 6400 is a very nice choice for wildlife, definitely a upgrade from a6000.
But animal eye AF and 425AF points man, that's bonkers for wildlife photography. I'm gonna sell my a6000 for this.
